column1: Zarinsk (Russian: Заринск) is a town in Altai Krai
column3: located on the Chumysh River 99 kilometers (62 mi) east of Barnaul. Population: 48

column1: The railway station of Zarinskaya (Заринская) was established in 1952. It was granted urban-type settlement status in 1958 and town status in 1979.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Zarinsk serves as the administrative center of Zarinsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of krai significance of Zarinsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of krai significance of Zarinsk is incorporated as Zarinsk Urban Okrug.
